instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MacBook Air 820 00165 short on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_SO_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Computer is liquid damaged, after cleaning it gives green then red light, no fan spin though. Found a short on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_SO_CPU</SIGNAL>. Looking at the schematic there looks to be many caps, the processor and <CAPACITOR>C1031</CAPACITOR>. Is there anything else that could be on that line causing the short or is it the processor? There is a lot if evidence that liquid has been on and around it.
Thanks

threads.title: MacBook Air 820 00165 short on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_SO_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Define short, what is resistance to GND?

threads.title: MacBook Air 820 00165 short on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_SO_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Diode mode
Red on ground black on each side of the cap it is 0
Black on ground red on each side of the cap it is 0

Beep testing
Black on ground and red on each side of the cap 2.5 Ohms

Thanks

threads.title: MacBook Air 820 00165 short on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_SO_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi,
Thats what I thought. 
Thanks again.
